title: English Language Arts: Grade 8
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

CF3F130BA8BA4A35B6602662199EF070.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and
phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension
or expression.

F3F01AC4F111474790E19B5B7D9507F3.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions)
(e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

E8CCFCE5579444C1970A13E216ED4FA1.description: Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

D43A495510CC426889CD3B82822C386E.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., verbal irony, puns) in context.

8AB477AA030D481AA304A2BEAD9A6847.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

D66D730A86AC4958BA1995CD00274E1A.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the
inferred meaning in context or by using other reference materials).

840F7F26BB8548A9932104A6157B92FA.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses)
to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of
speech.

572587E1D2BD44FC9754C93F09601469.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a
word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

64B2A0D6AABC42989053F567B4344630.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function
in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

1E6F6380900F48CB96B0703203A71412.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8
reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

F85723B67E07448B94D54327644C7FEF.description:
Use verbs in the active or passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve
particular effects (e.g., emphasizing the actor or the action; expressing uncertainty or describing
a state contrary to fact).

DE2EEFC250314EE5B9FEC0F040218246.description: Apply knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

9928FA540FCB441CAA1EDBE92C3782FB.description: Spell correctly, consulting references as needed.

12DAD3956EE34D7E8F5C7ED9081C8426.description: Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.

800B992C7DF04CCBBFE76B4450195300.description: Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

28ADB84563AF4E5FBE97510EB8A169BB.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

ED2556ECC78D40578A9BD6EC60347BC6.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

B61862D9D9684F5199C94C55C07FF81D.description:
Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive
mood.

123FC97FAC7B42CBB0187170FF85AA66.description: Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

B8BF04F485084F84A61C1A2298EF7EFE.description:
Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and their function in
particular sentences.

735A9DB09FC14792A422F7D3E8380486.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

D657843CB0704C67AE00F8C37B0728D7.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, such as conducting interviews and participating in
public performances, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate; use
appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation. (See grade 8 Language standards
1 and 3 for specific expectations)

82EF51B580034F8C86A6AC213F5F8AB1.description:
Integrate multimedia components and visual displays (e.g., graphics, images, charts and graphs,
sound, audio, interactive elements) in presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and
evidence, and add interest.

D5364CF41E354AED945DE1F5B67D2C7A.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant
evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details appropriate to the purpose, audience, and
task.

9AC747D60D0343399C1B8C4A79F639AE.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and
relevance and sufficiency of the evidence, and identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

E480A683DD5B4BF2B29FA6F79469F831.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually,
quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its
presentation.

533A0B77061546518F98A18DB83B9C21.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, justify or modify their
own views in light of the evidence presented.

F2F90737169D45DE97F0B2A6CFF739FA.description:
Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others’ questions
and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

8B2017C533EB48D383961C615DD753D0.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making (e.g., informal consensus, taking
votes on key issues, presentation of alternate views), track progress toward specific goals and
deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

CE2677251BDE4931B313A0A0220B1667.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw
on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on
ideas under discussion.

8BB431A5C85D4352A98234FF1BF98A83.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with
diverse partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their
own clearly.

E1323F0A122443F88332B4F0A54B43D0.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and
audiences.

93AE34DBC3D843898307A578B8BF56D1.description:
Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the
argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the
evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

DD55FC3DE9874D5188814C0617860793.description:
Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work of fiction
draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or
religious works, including describing how the material is rendered new”).

4C548FBC9CE0413AAD1B8A49ABC6E081.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

42BC82421B7F46AFBDFF8471926D9BB5.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on
several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of
exploration.

7C5F1012F621445397F84C4EB0CA7A6A.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

AA28984B096E4C7CB552C1EC35C5D26D.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing to interact and collaborate with others through a variety
of media to present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently, including linking to and
citing sources.

B892CED19F074A10BDF61227BB94B6A3.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by
planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and
audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1–3 up to and including grade 8.)

84240112A38B46E58DD3D748F66C871F.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to
task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–
3 above.)

631EE3C3778D4D0F8C318550F49D940E.description: Provide a conclusion that follows and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

BB0F02756BFD4B0E8A21F36E1942098A.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture
the action and convey experiences and events.

9A9C8D3025BD4C779AD87E9926D153CF.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from
one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and
events.

88410D7D794A41389F9BF17D170E2C7D.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop
experiences, events, and/or characters.

8784FFF6C8DA41EEA435F98AA5994E39.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a
narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

8E208B1458A84BE1A1ECBCD82643E900.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant
descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

7B4BD31F39474A7A821B610D4B0EC6E2.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or
explanation presented.

27C120141F004B3691712E30C178FC25.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

8FAC51BBEB9F4F7089656EA55D5FDCDC.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

A66471DE3EB741DF9255F11E37AA6399.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among
ideas and concepts.

71311B7895B34DFE9B6C1DADBEEAD27B.description:
Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or
other information and examples.

67008D2DF8F8470388113F90543AA2F7.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information
into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and
multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

62769E090FF1428BBB2E1757B801795B.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information
through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

6B7D9573C390466A96690AE3D4902674.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows and supports the argument presented.

91DF1ED400A5466D86F9B0167B1C2DC5.description: Establish and maintain a tone and style appropriate to the task and audience.

FE951AAB2AFE446987EEF9467028F4F8.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among
claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

57D590DEF2634362AA46E77E108A2956.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources
and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

6E6E748BF12942E88B7D7F276B9B5F8D.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims,
and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

DABAC7D31113412283E341CC80B1F9E1.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

B456A0AFF7B5408CABAA735E8EB51851.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction, at the high end of the grades 6-8 text
complexity band independently and proficiently.

5081482D705344F8B247B99A68A00E0A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F19DDB8C0DBA4F409FE07F1E81BCE22F.description:
Analyze how two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the
texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

D7E768B565C84656AED0E5630FF971F7.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is
sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

62E30B3D7D514080BCB20BF0E186C568.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video,
multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

A335A87E31FB4F5AB72079BA24862008.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and
responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

1B3BBCFACC234BF8B07196B592FFD8B4.description:
Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences
in developing and refining a key concept.

707C0FAB3A6545C2A081FC70F9A2EEC0.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative,
connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices and phrases on
meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

FF9ED508232F4CECB96BAF51B18B8099.description:
Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events
(e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

7E264CD73308464BAA8CF80EFFC1D5E7.description: Incorporate central ideas and their relationships into an objective summary of the text.

FD04AABD7E99449E9AEC6DE632526FF3.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text,
including its relationship to supporting ideas.

65539A5C4A474365B253DB82F3BC0AA1.description:
Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well
as inferences drawn from the text.

32B87B61619C4F3BBE842DE2CB6A6C77.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the
high end of grades 6-8 complexity band independently and proficiently.

1427D07CAC674D64B5A636BC1C42EA70.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

436F11B8E13842B3AFC39D3B8F80D771.description:
Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from
myths, traditional stories, or religious works, including describing how the material is rendered new.

3A6149FE8F59469EA4DC9DBF25EC8126.description:
Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs
from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

039E8FABB34749BF9F854C570092EFDC.description:
Analyze how differences in point of view and/or perspectives of the characters and the audience or
reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

02C736ED60B04FF8A7AE4CFD26D62549.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each
text contributes to its meaning and style.

7E68BE91E13B4CDF85423825FC6BCC55.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and
connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including
analogies or allusions to other texts.

252C3B5482F44577BCA0F0CE542E6A09.description:
Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal
aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

804A10EBBC32473DBC7D10DA94860E08.description:
Incorporate a theme and its relationship to other story elements into an objective summary of
the text.

519BA03A14824FEA8095B83BD09EB18E.description:
Determine a theme of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including
its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot.

D0D4631ACE2B4C6189F051261FD81C0F.description:
Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well
as inferences drawn from the text.
